what-it-does: Checks for uses of type that compare the type of an object to the type of None.
why-is-this-bad:
There is only ever one instance of None, so it is more efficient and
readable to use the is operator to check if an object is None.
example:
type(obj) is type(None)



Use instead:


obj is None
fix-safety: If the fix might remove comments, it will be marked as unsafe.
